text: The name Chaban, as well as variants such as Chabán, is a common surname and place name in several different countries. Chaban as a surname is of Zaporizhian Cossack (Ukraine) origin and means a shepherd. Chaban as an occupational term is used throughout Pontic steppes area as well as Carpathians and Caucasus. It may refer to the following people: * ,a Venezuelan actor; * , a French civil servant * Jacques Chaban-Delmas, a French politician; * Mykola Chaban, a Ukrainian journalist, or; * Omar Chabán, an Argentinian entrepreneur. Chaban may also refer to the following places: * , a street in Paris; * Château de Chaban a château in Aquitaine, France; * , an artificial lake in Charente, France * Pont Jacques Chaban-Delmas a bridge in Bordeaux, France, or; * Stade Chaban-Delmas a stadium in Bordeaux, France. Cha'ban may also refer to the French spelling of Sha'ban, one of the months of the Islamic lunar calendar. The French word was used in the post-Tanzimat Ottoman Empire context,, as French had the following roles: the main language of interacting with foreigners, and a common language among educated, (info page on book at Martin Luther University) Cited: p. 26 (PDF p. 28 - Quote: "[...]the French translations were in the eyes of some Ottoman statesmen the most important ones[...]") as well as a common language among non-Muslim subjects in the empire. (, 9781317118442), Google Books PT193. ==References==
title: Chaban
